if this happens, will the eventual setting of podIP trigger a watch update?  I don't know if status will trigger it.

@lavalamp

Yes, status updates cause watch events.

comments.body: nit: blank line
Removed
What does this case mean?  You got an update but don't know about the base object?  Should we handle it?
This PR watches all the endpoints. This helps filter out endpoints objects that do not belong to headless services.
If the endpoints object had a object reference to the service it belongs to, this map is probably not necessary.
It doesn't have an object ref, but it does have teh same name - is that good enough?
Thats true. I can use the service store instead of the additional map. I will make that change.
SGTM
If we're just going to destroy it and recreate it, why do we need the headlessServicesMap at all?
See above comment.
Why this, rather than just letting the loop terminate?
That will result in an extra unnecessary sleep.
You have a variable shadowing bug here... this will always be nil.
Good catch. I missed this during a rebase.
why these particular checks?
These are to validate the input master url. The url is needed to address the bootstrapping problem.
I get that, it just feels like ":" is a pretty random thing to test against - is this some idiom I don't know?
not particular to this line, just general - why make a function into a method if it has no need of the method-receiver?
Valid point Tim. I will fix it.
retries == 1?

ooooh, zing.  Good catch

> > -               return nil
> > -           }
> > -       } else {
> > -           log.Printf("Etcd server found: %v", _etcd_server)
> >   +func newEtcdClient(etcdServer string) (_etcd.Client, error) {
> > -   var (
> > -       client *etcd.Client
> > -       err    error
> > -   )
> > -   retries := maxConnectRetries
> > -   for retries > 0 {
> > -       if _, err = tools.GetEtcdVersion(etcdServer); err == nil {
> > -           break
> > -       }
> > -       if maxConnectRetries == 1 {
> 
> retries == 1?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/7901/files#r30101372
> .

Not the end of the world... If maxConnectRetries == 1, it'll just never print out the log message, and when it runs out of retries, it'll wait an extra 5 seconds. @vishh Worth fixing in a followup, though.

I am fixing it in a follow up PR with some real tests. Good catch!

On Tue, May 12, 2015 at 11:03 AM, Daniel Smith notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In cluster/addons/dns/kube2sky/kube2sky.go
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/7901#discussion_r30162136
> :
> 
> > -           } else {
> > -               return nil
> > -           }
> > -       } else {
> > -           log.Printf("Etcd server found: %v", _etcd_server)
> >   +func newEtcdClient(etcdServer string) (_etcd.Client, error) {
> > -   var (
> > -       client *etcd.Client
> > -       err    error
> > -   )
> > -   retries := maxConnectRetries
> > -   for retries > 0 {
> > -       if _, err = tools.GetEtcdVersion(etcdServer); err == nil {
> > -           break
> > -       }
> > -       if maxConnectRetries == 1 {

> Not the end of the world... If maxConnectRetries == 1, it'll just never
> print out the log message, and when it runs out of retries, it'll wait an
> extra 5 seconds. @vishh https://github.com/vishh Worth fixing in a
> followup, though.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/7901/files#r30162136
> .
You're potentially accessing a nil pointer here.  You need to return in the above if statement.
log.Fatal will call os.Exit(1). The etcd.NewClient function cannot return nil as it exists today. If that changes and we do get a nil here, there isn't much we can do to recover.
OK, makes sense.  I'd forgotten that log.Fatal() exits.
If the loop times out what happens? I don't see an error message or a crash.
Oops. Fixed.
I would much prefer you to use wait.Poll() here (from /pkg/util/wait/wait.go).  It's our "standard" retry loop.

I'd suggest making this error message more specific to aid debugging.  Something along the lines of:

"Timed out after xxx seconds waiting for at least 1 synchronized etcd server at [etcd_server] in the cluster."
nit: These should all be log.Fatal instead of log.Fatalf
(I think someone else was planning to overhaul this code, so we can wait for that to fix it.)
Will this use the v1beta3 API?
Changing to v1beta3 required other changes. I'd rather see that go in a different PR.
where does "tools" come from - I see no pkg named tools?
It's the tools package under "pkg/tools". It contained a number of nice etcd tools, which I modified and reused.
Wait, I think a bad merge dropped its import from this file. Let me fix that and push a new change.
Ok, taken care of. Thanks.
makes much more sense now :)
